name: Alison de la Paz
bio: Alison de la Paz is a contemporary composer whose work explores memory, movement, and connection through choral music.

name: María López
bio: María López is a composer focused on themes of heritage and belonging, writing accessible yet expressive choral music.

name: Alberto de la Paz
bio: Alberto de la Paz is an arranger known for adapting traditional works for contemporary choral ensembles.

name: Yosvany Estepe
bio: Yosvany Estepe is a composer whose work blends rhythmic vitality with cultural traditions.

name: Julio Morales
bio: Julio Morales writes large-scale choral works inspired by ritual, history, and orchestral color.

name: Lucía Fernández
bio: Lucía Fernández draws inspiration from folk traditions of South America, creating lyrical choral works.

name: Carlos Méndez
bio: Carlos Méndez composes bright, rhythmically driven choral music centered on renewal and hope.

name: Ana Ribeiro
bio: Ana Ribeiro explores nature and layered vocal textures in her contemporary choral writing.

name: Diego Torres
bio: Diego Torres writes percussive choral works focused on journeys, migration, and movement.

name: Elena Cruz
bio: Elena Cruz is known for expansive choral works inspired by landscapes and natural environments.

name: Raúl Hernández
bio: Raúl Hernández writes flowing upper-voice works that explore openness, light, and space.

name: Valentina Gómez
bio: Valentina Gómez creates contemporary choral music that experiments with echo, space, and texture.

name: Sofía Navarro
bio: Sofía Navarro composes gentle, flowing choral works inspired by the sea.

name: Miguel Ortiz
bio: Miguel Ortiz specializes in rich, lyrical writing for lower voices.

name: Isabel Ramírez
bio: Isabel Ramírez writes energetic choral music inspired by festivals and community traditions.
